title: Watch: India worst doping offender for third straight year, says WADA report

content: The Deputy Chief Minister was replying to a question raised by member Talawar Sabanna under Rule 330 in the Legislative Council in Belagavi

content: Local people find a car engulfed in flames on the roadside along the Dhoni-Mundur stretch near Arimani Estate

content: Condemning the ‚Äòthreats‚Äô allegedly made by the YSRCP chief to the companies involved in the construction of the colleges, the Minister challenged him to seek a CBI inquiry, or legal action, if he has proof of any wrongdoing

content: Somanath says that classical approaches still continue and integration of artificial intelligence in practice is not happening

content: Lebanese filmmaker Cyril Aris‚Äôs debut feature highlights the beauty of enduring relationships while reflecting the fragility of life in conflict.

title: BJP to rope in national leaders for ‚ÄòAtal Modi Suparipalana Yatra‚Äô
content: It will conclude in Amaravati on December 25, in which Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu and Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan will participate

content: HC directive upon being informed that the authorities permitted mutation and accepted register of rights, beyond what was permitted in the court‚Äôs previous order

content: Deputy Chief Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin rejects criticism of AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K. Palaniswami over distribution of laptops to students in the middle of academic year

title: Assault case: bail plea of P.T. Kunju Muhammed posted on Saturday
content: Kunju Muhammed‚Äôs counsel argued that the case was fabricated and alleged the woman of trespassing into his room. His charges were strongly refuted by the prosecution while opposing his bail plea

title: Employee unions stage protest in Ballari against 100% FDI in insurance
content: ‚ÄòThe proposed hike in FDI limit from 74% to 100% will seriously undermine the domestic insurance sector‚Äô

title: India issued 200 medical visas since launch of new Afghan visa in April: Health Ministry
content: India reaffirmed its commitment to supporting Afghanistan‚Äôs health sector and humanitarian needs during a meeting between Union Health Minister J.P. Nadda and Afghanistan‚Äôs Minister of Public Health Mawlawi Noor Jalal Jalali

title: CM pats Nellore Collector for ‚ÄòChampion Farmers‚Äô initiative
content: The programme aims to bring comprehensive reforms in the agricultural sector, says Himanshu Shukla during Collectors‚Äô Conference

title: Iran To Tajikistan: Probe Agency Uncovers New Trail In Kerala Kidney Racket
content: A Kochibased man accused of running an international kidney racket allegedly trafficked poor Indians not just to Iran, but also to Tajikistan for illegal transplants, latest National Investigation Agency (NIA) case records show.

title: "Raw Sewage, Broken Toilets": Plight Of US Troops On Mexico Border
content: Some US Army troops posted along the southern border as part of the Trump administration's heightened immigration enforcement efforts are living under substandard conditions in Texas and New Mexico, according to a report.

title: "Had A Muslim Man Lifted Hindu Woman's Veil...": Omar Abdullah On Hijab Row
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah, speaking on the hijab row in Bihar and the BJP's reaction to it, said today that one can expect no better from the party.

title: Saudi Arabia Deports 24,000 Pakistani Beggars After Warning To Islamabad
content: Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates have tightened scrutiny on Pakistani nationals amid growing concerns over organised begging and criminal activity abroad, a trend Pakistani authorities say is harming the country's international standing.

title: Lamborghini Urus, BMW Z4 Among Luxury Cars Found In Raid On UP YouTuber
content: A YouTuber who made a gazillion amounts of money from online betting and gambling apps lived lavishly, with a garage full of high-end sports cars. Anurag Dwivedi, who also runs a YouTube channel, is a resident of Uttar Pradesh's Unnao.

title: "Greatest Strategic Challenge Since 1971": S Tharoor-Led Panel On Bangladesh
content: The current situation in Bangladesh poses the "greatest strategic challenge" for India since the Liberation war of 1971, said a parliamentary committee headed by Congress's Shashi Tharoor.

title: Red Fort Blast: 9th Accused Sent To Anti-Terror Agency NIA's Custody Till Dec 26
content: A Delhi court on Thursday remanded Yasir Ahmad Dar, the ninth accused arrested in a case related to the Red Fort blast, to NIA custody till December 26.

title: Delhi Air Quality Worsens Despite Stricter Anti-Pollution Measures
content: A blanket of haze enveloped Delhi on Thursday, reducing visibility across the city as air pollution worsened, with the 24-hour average AQI in the 'very poor' category with a reading of 373, up from 334 a day earlier, according to official data.

title: Parliament Passes SHANTI Bill To Allow Private Players In Nuclear Sector
content: Parliament on Thursday passed the nuclear energy bill, with the Rajya Sabha giving its nod to the legislation that seeks to open the tightly-controlled civil nuclear sector for private participation.

title: Case Against Hyderabad Mall, Organisers After Actor Nidhhi Agerwal Mobbed At Event
content: A case was registered here on Thursday against management of a mall and the event organisers after actress Nidhhi Agerwal was allegedly mobbed by a crowd following the launch of a song from the upcoming Prabhas-starrer 'The Raja Saab', police said.

title: IndiGo Disruptions To Be Probed By Competition Commission Too
content: The CCI will look into IndiGo's mass flight cancellations across several routes, the country's fair trade regulator said in a statement.

title: India Excludes Gold, Silver, Dairy From Trade Pact With Oman
content: India has protected the interest of domestic farmers and MSMEs by not extending any duty concessions on products across several sectors.

title: All You Need To Know About India's Free Trade Agreements
content: India on Thursday signed a trade pact -- Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) -- with Oman, its 17th deal so far as the country aims to boost bilateral trade and investments.

title: Sourav Ganguly Files Complaint Against 'Argentina Fan Club' Head Over Remarks
content: Former India cricket captain Sourav Ganguly on Thursday lodged a police complaint against the head of Kolkata-based 'Argentina football fan club', alleging that the individual made objectionable remarks against him, a senior officer said.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Good vs Evil: Will Vijay's Tamil Nadu Election Pitch Succeed?
content: By framing the upcoming election as a battle between good and evil, Vijay is deliberately reviving memories of the Jayalalithaa-Karunanidhi rivalry - an intense, deeply personal feud that defined Tamil Nadu politics until they died.

title: 3 Arrested For Raping, Blackmailing 19-Year-Old Girl In Bengaluru: Cops
content: The Bengaluru South District police arrested 3 men including two students on Wednesday for allegedly raping a 19-year-old college student for two months. According to police, the incident dates back to September and October in Magadi Town.

title: Video: Australia Cops Arrest 7 Near Bondi Beach Over 'Violent Attack' Plan
content: Amid an ongoing investigation regarding the Bondi Beach attack in Australia, police carried out an operation in a Sydney suburb with heavily armed officers ramming a car and detaining 7 men on Thursday.

title: 'Road Accidents Killed More People Than Any War': Nitin Gadkari In Parliament
content: The number of people killed in road accidents in India is more than casualties in a war or the Covid pandemic, Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari said in parliament today.

title: Newborn Girl's Body Found In Toilet Commode In Madhya Pradesh Hospital
content: Just weeks after Madhya Pradesh became a grim symbol of state failure with the deaths of more than 20 children due to poisoned cough syrup, another chilling incident has surfaced, this time from inside a government hospital itself.

title: Amid 'G Ram G' Row, Mamata Banerjee To Rename Bengal Scheme After Mahatma Gandhi
content: Amid an ongoing political storm over the renaming of the MGNREGA scheme for rural jobs, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said her government will bring a bill in the state Cabinet to rename the Karmashree scheme after Mahatma Gandhi.

title: Jagan‚Äôs flawed understanding of PPP model exposed, says Lanka Dinakar
content: YSRCP‚Äôs double standards on the issue is evident from its endorsement of private participation in medical education at the national level and opposition to it in the State, observes TDP leader Pattabhiram

title: Collapsing roads and retaining walls of newly developed NH stretches in Kerala cause concern among residents
content: On December 5 afternoon, motorists and other passengers on the service road beneath the under-construction National Highway 66 stretch at Mylakkadu in Kollam were jolted by the sudden disintegration of the Reinforced Soil (RS) wall of the embankment, which spewed soil and rubble onto the road. As they ran for their lives abandoning their vehicles, it seemed like the repeat of a similar collapse at Kooriyad in Malappuram earlier. The incidents raise questions over the safety of the RS structures built and being built at various parts of the State. Experts and residents say lack of rigorous soil testing and inadequate geotechnical investigation are the primary causes of the collapses

title: Govt. yet to refund educational expenses of 461 children of farmers who ended their lives due to drought in Karnataka
content: Madhu Bangarappa says educational expenses of the remaining 461 students are pending due to non-submission of proposals from respective districts

title: IUML makes historic gains across Kerala in local body polls
content: Party secures 3,203 seats across Corporations, municipalities and the three tiers of panchayats, 865 seats more than its 2020 tally. This time, it has secured more seats outside Malappuram district (1,747) than within it (1,456).  In southern Kerala several non-Muslim candidates have been elected under the IUML banner

title: Sanjay Saraogi assumes charge as Bihar BJP State President, expresses gratitude to party workers
content: New State unit chief stresses organisational strength, party ideology, and worker participation in Bihar

title: Hyderabad‚Äôs IT belt sees one-third fall in traffic as year-end festive break sets in
content: Traffic volumes on key stretches have dropped by 25‚Äì33% within two weeks as festive offs and work-from-home peak, commuters report shorter travel times

title: Watch: Thirupparankundram Karthigai Deepam Row: A Legal History | Focus Tamil Nadu
content: Public debate in Tamil Nadu has intensified over the Karthigai Deepam lighting at the historic Thirupparankundram Hills in Madurai. With the matter still unresolved, here‚Äôs a look at the history and legal background of this long-running dispute.

title: Bombay High Court refuses bail to Daman Crime Branch constables accused of abduction, extortion
content: Constables accused of extorting ‚Çπ7 lakh from abductees; court calls probe ‚Äúquestionable‚Äù and says crimes by the police ‚Äúundermine the integrity of the justice system‚Äù

title: Stress on collective responsibility to prevent trafficking in women and children
content: Workshop jointly organised by the district administration, the ZP, the DLSA and the Department of Women and Child Development in Ballari

title: Income soars to ‚Çπ210 crore at Sabarimala
content: With pilgrims using forest trekking routes to reach the Sannidhanam, authorities are mulling introducing special passes for those arriving via the Erumely-Azhutha path. Daily limit of 5,000 spot bookings will continue, says TDB president

title: Hyderabad CP calls for zero-delay response at tri-commissionerate meet
content: Regardless of where a crime occurs, the nearest police unit must respond immediately without debating jurisdiction, says Sajjanar

title: Concerns mount over suspected bird flu outbreak in Kuttanad
content: Samples have been collected and sent to the National Institute of High Security Animal Diseases in Bhopal for analysis to determine the cause of deaths

title: Live-in relationships are not illegal, State must protect such couples, says Allahabad High Court
content: The court orders the Uttar Pradesh police to provide protection to 12 live-in couples allegedly threatened by their families

title: Five babies rescued from trafficking gang, 10 arrested in A.P.
content: The gang allegedly used to purchase babies from Delhi and Mumbai and sell them to childless couples for ‚Çπ5 lakh, say police

title: A.P. farmer develops cost-effective tool to remove weeds
content: The ‚Äòcycle weeder‚Äô, developed by P. Lakshmi Narayana from Reddypalem village in Kothapatnam mandal of Prakasam district costs only ‚Çπ1,000

title: India, Netherlands reaffirm defence ties
content: Letter of Intent on defence cooperation exchanged; Ministers highlight the importance of connecting the defence industries of both countries, particularly in niche and emerging technologies

title: IMA flags threats to nation‚Äôs affordable, accessible health system
content: IMA argues that urgent reforms are necessary to prevent over 55 million people from falling into poverty due to healthcare costs each year.

title: An open letter to the Indian government in support of the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act
content: ‚ÄòMGNREGA has captured the world‚Äôs attention with its demonstrated achievements and innovative design. To dismantle it now would be a historic error‚Äô

title: 'Greatest challenge since 1971': House panel flags Pak, China influence in B'desh
content: India faces its greatest strategic challenge in Bangladesh since 1971. A parliamentary committee warns of Islamist resurgence, weakening political structures, and growing Chinese and Pakistani influence. This situation poses a long-term strategic test for India's regional stability and neighborhood policy. The government is monitoring developments and engaging with Bangladesh's interim government.

title: Water crisis: These states are hurtling towards 'Day Zero'; is it too late?
content: India faces a severe water crisis, with 600 million people experiencing extreme stress. Groundwater, the nation's lifeline, is being depleted faster than it replenishes, particularly in agricultural regions. Over-extraction, pollution, and weak regulations are exacerbating the situation, pushing cities and rural areas towards 'Day Zero' scenarios. Urgent action is needed.

title: The grand old party‚Äôs crisis: Why Congress partymen are parting ways
content: Former Odisha MLA Mohammed Moquim's letter to Sonia Gandhi highlights a growing disconnect between Congress leadership and its workers, echoing concerns raised during recent state elections. The party faces persistent issues like infighting, disillusioned cadres, and senior leaders departing, raising questions about its ability to reform and regain relevance.

title: 'Violent act' foiled in Australia: 7 held in Sydney; PM vows to stamp out hatred
content: Sydney police thwarted a potential violent act on Thursday, arresting seven men in the city's southwest following a tip-off. While the investigation is ongoing, authorities have found no link to the recent Bondi Beach antisemitic shooting. Footage showed officers intercepting vehicles and detaining suspects.

title: Sourav Ganguly files Rs 50 cr defamation case over Lionel Messi Kolkata event chaos
content: Former India cricket captain Sourav Ganguly has filed a Rs 50 crore defamation suit against Uttam Saha, president of the Argentina Fan Club of Kolkata. Saha had alleged Ganguly's involvement in the chaotic Messi event at Yuva Bharati Stadium. Ganguly, who was an invited guest, denies any organizational role, calling the accusations baseless and damaging to his reputation.

title: Warner Bros-Netflix deal: WBD wants Oracle founder‚Äôs backing
content: Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) has rejected Paramount Skydance's $108 billion hostile takeover bid, deeming it "misleading" and "inadequate." WBD's board urged shareholders to reject the offer, citing financial concerns and a lack of a personal guarantee from Larry Ellison. The company reiterated its preference for a merger agreement with Netflix, which it considers superior and more transparent.

title: Dec 18 Throwback: When Messi lifted WC ‚Äî and touched immortality
content: On December 18, 2022, Lionel Messi finally achieved his lifelong dream, leading Argentina to World Cup glory in a thrilling final against France. Despite an early setback, Messi inspired his team, scoring crucial goals and demonstrating unwavering belief. This victory cemented his legacy, fulfilling a pursuit that defined his career and a generation of fans.

title: Struggling to sell AI tools? xAI faces Grok 'problem'; trails OpenAI, Google
content: Elon Musk's xAI faces a sales hurdle for its Grok AI tools, primarily due to a lack of enterprise sales experience compared to established rivals like Google and OpenAI.  Current adoption is limited to small trials, with large corporations hesitant to commit without a proven track record.  xAI is now actively seeking to expand its business client base.

title: Who is Nidhhi Agerwal? Actress mobbed at Hyderabad mall event
content: In a shocking turn of events, actress Nidhhi Agerwal encountered a harrowing mobbing experience following a song launch in Hyderabad, with footage circulating online depicting her fight to navigate through the throngs of fans. This unsettling incident has ignited a firestorm of criticism across social media platforms.

title: Got a msg from I-T dept? Big clarification issued - what taxpayers need to know
content: The Income Tax Department clarified that recent communications to taxpayers about transaction discrepancies are advisory, aiming for voluntary compliance. These messages highlight gaps between filed returns and reported information, encouraging review of Annual Information Statements and timely correction of returns to avoid enforcement.

title: Ghaziabad horror: Landlady goes to collect rent; her body found inside suitcase
content: A Ghaziabad woman was tragically found dead in a suitcase under a bed in her rented flat. She had reportedly gone to collect overdue rent from her tenants, a couple who have since been detained. The discovery was made by her domestic help after the victim failed to return home. Police are investigating the motive and cause of death.

title: Amazon layoffs: Biggest ever job cuts in Europe; these roles are impacted the most
content: Amazon is cutting 370 jobs, or 8.5% of its Luxembourg workforce, impacting software developers as the company embraces AI. This reduction follows a global layoff of 14,000 employees and comes after negotiations resulted in a reduced number from the initial plan. Despite the cuts, Amazon reaffirms Luxembourg as a strategic European partner.

title: TN exporters hit by US tariff hike: CM Stalin writes to PM; warns of economic fallout
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to address the crisis faced by state exporters due to a 50% US tariff hike. The increase has led to massive order cancellations, production cuts, and significant daily revenue losses, pushing many SMEs towards collapse.

title: Anti-India protests in B'desh: Two visa centres closed; rally at consulate - key points
content: India's Dhaka visa application centre has reopened after a temporary closure due to an anti-India protest. However, centres in Khulna and Rajshahi remain shut due to security concerns. India has expressed strong concern to Bangladesh over the deteriorating security environment around its mission.

title: IPL 2026: R Ashwin leaves out CSK from his top four, fourth pick comes as surprise
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has revealed his top four IPL contenders, notably excluding his former team Chennai Super Kings. He placed Mumbai Indians at the forefront, followed by defending champions Royal Challengers Bengaluru, Punjab Kings, and Rajasthan Royals. Ashwin lauded Mumbai Indians' strategic acquisition of Quinton de Kock, believing they are aiming to replicate their 2020 championship squad's balance.

title: Braun Strowman & Raquel Rodriguez net worth 2025: WWE earnings, lifestyle
content: Braun Strowman and Raquel Rodriguez showcase contrasting WWE financial journeys in 2025. Strowman, a former headliner, boasts an estimated net worth of $2-5 million, built on lucrative deals and merchandise. Rodriguez, a rising star, has a projected $700,000, with her value steadily increasing through television exposure and championship opportunities.

title: Gisele B√ºndchen stuns on Florida jet ski date as ex-Tom Brady fuels NFL comeback talk
content: Gisele B√ºndchen and Joaquim Valente embraced a sun-drenched holiday with a jet ski outing near their Florida home, prioritizing family and privacy after welcoming their son. This choice reflects B√ºndchen's current focus on grounding moments and personal strength over public spectacle. Meanwhile, Tom Brady confirmed his NFL retirement is permanent due to his ownership stake in the Raiders.

title: Are Cooper DeJean and Nikki Bella dating? WWE and NFL clues spark buzz
content: Speculation is rife as photos surface of Eagles' Cooper DeJean and WWE's Nikki Bella, hinting at a possible relationship.  The timeline includes DeJean attending a WWE event and Bella posing in his locker room.  While no official confirmation exists, the 20-year age gap has sparked online debate, with many defending the pair's privacy and right to live their lives.

title: 'Sleepy Joe, divisive Obama: Trump turns White House into permanent reply thread
content: The most visible, and perhaps the most revealing, manifestation of this impulse is the newly installed Presidential Walk of Fame, a peculiar cynosure of the Trump effect on Washington. It is part surreal, part satire, and completely on brand.

title: NCP minister quits: Convicted in fraud case; CM Fadnavis accepts resignation
content: Maharashtra minister Manikrao Kokate resigned after a court issued arrest warrants in a 1995 housing quota case. Deputy CM  Ajit Pawar accepted the resignation in principle, forwarding it to CM Devendra Fadnavis.  The Governor has now allocated Kokate's former ministries to Pawar. This follows a similar incident with another NCP politician.

title: Will Alexander Ovechkin play vs Leafs tonight? Latest Capitals update
content: The Washington Capitals are set to face the Toronto Maple Leafs tonight at Capital One Arena, with all eyes on captain Alexander Ovechkin. It is expected that he will play, continuing his standout season with 14 goals and 17 assists in 33 games. His presence is crucial as Washington looks to leverage his scoring and leadership in this key NHL matchup.

title: Canadian-Sikh lawyer who refused to swear oath to King Charles ‚Äì got the law changed
content: A Sikh lawyer successfully challenged Alberta's mandatory oath of allegiance to the King, securing a landmark ruling. The Alberta Court of Appeal declared the requirement a violation of religious freedom under the Charter. This decision brings the province in line with others, allowing for alternative affirmations and upholding Canada's pluralistic society.

title: Japanese woman breaks engagement, marries AI character she created instead
content: A Japanese woman, Yurina Noguchi, has married her AI partner, Lune Klaus Verdure, created using ChatGPT. Previously engaged to a human, Noguchi called off her human relationship and developed feelings for the AI character after seeking its advice. She wore a wedding gown and AR glasses for the ceremony, with an expert reading Klaus's vows.

title: Exodus: Over 2L Indians renouncing citizenship every year; why are they leaving?
content: Nearly a million Indians have renounced their citizenship in five years, with over two lakh annually since 2022. This trend, raises questions about quality of life, governance, and taxation. While the government cites personal reasons and views the diaspora as an asset, the lack of dual citizenship is a key factor driving this significant outflow.

title: Annamalai arrested: TN cops say no permit for anti-garbage stir; BJP condemns action
content: Tamil Nadu police detained former BJP state president K Annamalai and party workers protesting against the dumping of waste from Tiruppur city in Chinnakalipalayam village. The BJP criticized the arrest, calling it a condemnable act by the Stalin government for supporting local residents.

title: Ishan Kishan sends message to India selectors with SMAT performance
content: Ishan Kishan smashed a brilliant 101 off 47 balls in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy Elite 2025 final. His innings helped Jharkhand reach 180 for 1 in 14 overs against Haryana. Kishan finished as the tournament's top scorer. He partnered with Kumar Kushagra for an unbeaten 177-run stand. Jharkhand secured a dominant position in the match.

title: Inside Josh Allen‚Äôs luxury car collection: A look at the Bills star‚Äôs garage
content: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen's impressive car collection showcases his journey from humble beginnings to NFL stardom. His garage features a mix of rugged trucks like the Ford F-150 Raptor and luxury SUVs such as the Jeep Grand Wagoneer and Range Rover Sport, reflecting his need for utility and comfort in Buffalo's climate.

title: 15 years on, Uttarakhand HC upholds life term for husband who cut wife into 72 pieces
content: Fifteen years after a software engineer murdered his wife, dismembered her body, and disposed of the remains, the Uttarakhand High Court has upheld his life imprisonment. The brutal crime, which occurred in October 2010, came to light when the victim's brother filed a missing complaint, leading to the discovery of body parts and the engineer's arrest.

title: Arjun Rampal reacts to Preity Zinta‚Äôs Dhurandhar praise
content: Arjun Rampal praised Preity Zinta‚Äôs passion for 'Dhurandhar', saying her excitement inspired him deeply. The actor thanked her on Instagram, expressing gratitude for her constant support. Preity, after watching the film, called it ‚Äúraw, real, and powerful,‚Äù hailing Aditya Dhar‚Äôs direction and the performances of Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna, Rampal, and others.

title: BCCI not responsible for Lucknow T20I ticket refunds: Secretary Saikia
content: Spectators of the abandoned India-South Africa T20I in Lucknow will receive refunds, confirmed BCCI Secretary Devajit Saikia. The Uttar Pradesh Cricket Association (UPCA) will manage reimbursements for the match called off due to dense fog and poor visibility. Saikia highlighted the unpredictable nature of winter weather, noting this was an exceptional situation despite BCCI's efforts to reschedule domestic games.

title: How Indian-origin Ramaswamy decides who is 'American'
content: Ramaswamy‚Äôs core claim is classically conservative and quietly radical in today‚Äôs climate: Americanness is binary. You are either American or you are not. There are no gradations based on skin colour, ancestry, or how early your family arrived.

title: Journey to hell & back: Odisha man held as 'spy' in conflict-torn Sudan returns home
content: An Odia man's hope for a better life in Sudan turned into a nightmare when civil war erupted, leading to his capture by paramilitary forces. After enduring months of hardship and captivity, he was finally rescued and returned home, thanks to the intervention of the Indian government and international organizations.

title: Pakistan kabaddi player plays for Indian Team, set to face disciplinary action
content: Pakistani kabaddi star Ubaidullah Rajput faces disciplinary action after donning an Indian jersey at a Bahrain tournament.  Organizers reportedly named private teams after countries, but Rajput claims he was unaware of the team's "Indian" designation.  He apologized, stating he wouldn't represent India, especially given regional tensions. The Pakistan Kabaddi Federation is investigating.

title: Global campuses in India could cut foreign education expenses by billions: What it means
content: Foreign universities are no longer just a policy dream in India‚Äîthey are turning into campuses, classrooms and choices. The promise is tempting: global pedagogy, less visa anxiety, and a lower overall cost than studying abroad. But the fine print matters. If fees soar and campuses cluster in metros, this ‚Äúglobal upgrade‚Äù could deepen divides rather than deliver broad-based gains.

title: Clash of egos: Is GCL making chess players talk as teams?
content: The Global Chess League is transforming the individual sport into a team setting, challenging the traditional solitary nature of chess. Players from diverse backgrounds are now sharing jerseys and coaches, fostering interaction and fun. This shift encourages communication and collaboration, proving that even in a fiercely competitive arena, greatness doesn't have to be a lonely pursuit.

title: G RAM G Bill gets LS nod: What is it - and why is opposition protesting
content: Lok Sabha passed the Viksit Bharat Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) Bill, replacing MGNREGA with a 125-day wage employment guarantee for rural households. Opposition protested, calling it an attack on Gandhi's legacy and accusing the government of undermining rural development. Supporters claim it will boost villages and deter corruption.

title: Tua Tagovailoa net worth 2025: Contracts, endorsements and earnings
content: Tua Tagovailoa's NFL journey has transformed him from a debated prospect to a franchise cornerstone.  By 2025, his substantial earnings from a lucrative Dolphins contract and a diverse endorsement portfolio, including Adidas and EA Sports, have propelled his net worth to an estimated $30-$40 million, solidifying his financial elite status.

title: Dec 18 throwback: When 16-year-old Sachin began his ODI journey ‚Äî and cricket found a legend
content: Thirty-six years ago today, a 16-year-old Sachin Tendulkar made his ODI debut against Pakistan, facing a formidable Waqar Younis and departing for a duck. This anti-climactic start belied a legendary career that would see him become cricket's highest ODI run-scorer. The rain-affected match saw India narrowly lose by seven runs.

title: Up to 7 yrs jail, Rs 50k fine: K'taka cracks down on hate speech; BJP raises objection
content: Karnataka Assembly passed a hate speech bill despite BJP protests. The legislation defines hate speech broadly, aiming to curb expressions causing disharmony or enmity. It includes provisions for jail terms and victim compensation. Exemptions exist for public interest and good faith acts. The government asserts it's crucial for maintaining peace and order.

title: Michaela Benthaus set to become first wheelchair user in space
content: German aerospace engineer Michaela Benthaus, a wheelchair user since 2018, is set to make history as the first person with a disability to travel to space. She will join five others on Blue Origin's 37th New Shepard mission, a suborbital flight offering a glimpse of Earth from above. This flight highlights increased accessibility in space exploration.

title: TER cut: Think your mutual fund got cheaper? Read the fine print
content: SEBI's mutual fund TER changes are a transparency reset, not just a fee reduction. By unbundling costs and separating levies, SEBI aims for clearer investor understanding. Tightened brokerage caps and removed exit load charges offer potential real savings beyond the headline number.

title: 150 prospects, 12 schools, 7 rounds: We stacked players in the CFP by NFL draft stock
content: the top 12 teams of the 2025 CFB season have plenty of prospects for the 2026 draft . we're identifying each player in the playoff who could be selected in the upcoming draft and which round they'd fit best right now . this is where things stand right now and a good picture of which teams could be sending a bunch of top talent to the early rounds .

title: How Wallstedt, Bussi and five other NHL goalies leveled up their play this season
content: jesper wallstedt is a Minnesota Wild goaltender who's rewriting the franchise's rookie record books . he's at the top of a goaltending wave bringing new freshmen to light in the season's first half . it's almost a mystery how these things work .
